> 💡 **Useful Tip:** Put a Meowth on your shoulder before battling the NPC and make sure to not switch into it. This will double the amount of PokeDollars earned when defeating the NPC!

### Selling Pokemon on the GTS

As mentioned earlier, you can sell pokemon to other players! There's two methods of doing this, the first requires both you and the buyer being online and on the same server, the buyer using the command:

```
/pay [player username] [amount]
```

And yourself using the command:

```
/pokegift [player username] [pokemon slot]
```

There is a more ideal way of selling pokemon to players that doesn't require one player waiting on another, and that's with the Global Trade System (GTS)! The GTS allows you to post pokemon up for sale into an in-game marketplace! Any player can then buy the pokemon from the market, making this entire process not requiring both the seller and the buyer to be online at the same time! You can use the following command to upload the pokemon for sale:

```
/gts sell [pokemon slot] [amount]
```

And if the pokemon did or did not sell after 24 hours, you can claim the pokemon or the money with the following command:

```
/gts claim
```

> **Note:** There is a confirmation screen that shows you the pokemon you wish to sell and the amount you wish to sell it for, but you should still make sure you're not accidentally selling the wrong pokemon or for the wrong amount!

### Complete Pokemon and Breeding Hunts

On each world server (and Area Zero) there are 2 sets of 6 different hunts to complete within a period of time!

**Pokemon hunts** involve catching specific pokemon with specific abilities, IV percentage, and/or sometimes requiring being caught in a specific pokeball!

**Breeding Hunts** require you to breed either any pokemon from a specific Egg Group, or a specific pokemon altogether, requiring specific Natures, IV percentages, and/or ability!

It's recommended to attempt to do the first two (from the top left) hunts, as they are typically the easiest to complete and have less requirements!

### Completing Pokedex Tasks

You can also earn money from completing a pokemon's pokedex tasks! Every pokemon has it's own pokedex tasks that can be found by right clicking a pokemon while holding your poketch, or by using the following command:

```
/pokedex search [pokemon]
```

You'll find the pokedex tasks of a pokemon when you hover over the pokedex icon to the left of the shown pokemon! If you're having trouble finding the tasks, use the following guide: https://discord.com/channels/511621928646344724/1335032594793889914

### Defeating Gyms

Cobblemon Delta has our own gym system, where you can battle any of the 8 gym types of the season! Remember, the gym leaders aren't NPCs, they're players who are very experienced at battling and are using competitively viable teams! You ideally need a full team of level 100 BP pokemon and a good strategy in order to beat a gym leader!

If you manage to win, you'll be rewarded:

- PokeDollars
- BattlePoints
- Rare Candies
- The Gym Leader's Badge
- Random shiny (chance)

For more information on Gyms, please head to the following channel: https://discord.com/channels/511621928646344724/1096629245473734756

## Events

Server Events are PvE minigames that any player can participate in! Best part about it? Regardless of how long a player has played on the server, there are no outside means of advantages besides knowledge and experience of playing the events (besides Catch Contest)!

These events are hosted at the following times:

- 3pm EST/EDT (Currently EDT)
- 9pm EST/EDT (Currently EDT)
- 3am EST/EDT (Currently EDT)

Specific Staff will host the following based off of a schedule:

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| 🧊 Avalugg Crush | Step on the Green Carpets and don't get crushed by the falling Avalugg! |
| 🎣 Catch Contest | Catch as many different species of pokemon of a specific type before time runs out! |
| 🕳️ Cave Escape | Jump your way up to the surface before time runs out! |
| 🎮 PokeGames | Find Pokemon, get them ready, battle trainers, and be the last one standing! |
| ❄️ Spleef | Don't fall into the Lava! Break snow blocks and drop others down! |
| 🏃 Triathlon | Run, jump and fly through obstacles to make it to the end! |
| ⚡ Voltorb Tag | Hide, run, or hit others with a voltorb! Don't get tagged before time runs out! |
| ❓ Who's That Pokemon | Guess what pokemon other players are building, or build a pokemon and be as accurate as possible! |

Participating in Server Events rewards players with a currency exclusively from Events, **Event Points**! You can use Event Points to redeem different rewards from the Event Shop, such as master balls, claim blocks, random shinies, crate keys, and even items from our Seasonal Events! You can access the Event Shop with the following command:

```
/eventshop
```

All Server Events will reward players who at least participate in them 5 Event Points! On events that have a finish line, so long as you reach the end, you'll earn at least 15 Event Points! Besides that, being in the top 10 of any Event will reward you at least 15 Event Points!

Remember that these Events are optional, but it's the only way to earn Event Points!

---

If you have any questions regarding anything that's been touched upon in this guide, you can check out guides that go into more detail, ask a staff member, or ask your questions in our questions channel or in game! These guides will be listed in the post that this guide is in, and as more guides get posted, they will be shared there!

title: 🌌 An Ultimate Ultra Space Guide 🌌
description: Welcome to Ultra Space! Get ready to embark on an exciting journey into a world filled with incredible discoveries and adventures. In Ultra Space, you'll encounter Ultra Pokémon, explore mysterious wormholes and nests, tackle Ultra Wild Nests, hunt for rare Nihilego loot, and even collect Silvally memories—plus so much more! This guide is here to help you navigate every corner of Ultra Space, making your experience both fun and rewarding. Let's dive in and see what Ultra Space has in store for you!
author: AmaTheGoodra
body:
# 🌌 An Ultimate Ultra Space Guide 🌌

**By: AmaTheGoodra**

Welcome to Ultra Space! Get ready to embark on an exciting journey into a world filled with incredible discoveries and adventures. In Ultra Space, you'll encounter Ultra Pokémon, explore mysterious wormholes and nests, tackle Ultra Wild Nests, hunt for rare Nihilego loot, and even collect Silvally memories—plus so much more! This guide is here to help you navigate every corner of Ultra Space, making your experience both fun and rewarding. Let's dive in and see what Ultra Space has in store for you!

## Getting Started

📝 To get started, type `/warp ultraspace` in chat to teleport to our main Ultra Space Portal.

Once inside, your first and most important step is to speak to the nearby NPC and purchase a full set of Ruby Armor (5,000 Pokédollars per piece). Make sure you equip the entire set before exploring, as you cannot survive in Ultra Space without it!

> **Note:** Ruby Armor is only effective in Ultra Space, and we do not recommend using it outside of Ultra Space.

## What's Next?

Now that you have your armor, your main journey can begin! Once you approach the NPC, you can look to your left and enter the portal. You'll be given two options:

- Ultra Space
- Ultra Megalopolis

If you choose **Ultra Space**, you'll be randomly teleported to one of several unique biomes, including:

- Ultra Deep Sea
- Ultra Jungle
- Ultra Desert
- Ultra Plant
- Ultra Forest
- Ultra Crater
- Ultra Ruin
- Ultra Burst
- Ultra Grove
- Ultra Oasis
- Distortion (Note: This biome is at a lower Y level than all the others!)

Alternatively, if you pick **Ultra Megalopolis**, you'll be transported to the city where you can start completing quests to raise your level in Ultra Space. Leveling up here is a major requirement for progressing further! You can also use the command `/warp UltraMegalopolis` to be placed right in front of the quest NPC, Phyco, to begin your adventure right away.

## Ultra Megalopolis & Phyco - The Basics

### Main NPC: Phyco

You'll spend a lot of time with Phyco! Talk to him to access three main options:

### Levels

This is your main progression system in Ultra Space. To level up, complete Ultra Nests/Wormholes and collect special gems (check yours with `/gems`). Some levels also require you to complete a set number of Quests before you can advance!

**Quest Milestones Needed for Levels:**

| Level | Quests Required |
|-------|-----------------|
| 4     | 1 Quest         |
| 6     | 5 Quests        |
| 10    | 10 Quests       |
| 14    | 15 Quests       |
| 18    | 20 Quests       |
| 22    | 25 Quests       |
| 26    | 30 Quests       |
| 30    | 35 Quests       |
| 33    | 40 Quests       |
| 38    | 45 Quests       |

> **Note:** Some quests (like "Hatch Rockruff Eggs," "Dungeon Exploration," and "Defeat Lusamine") may not be available yet.

### Quests

Quests are essential for leveling up and sometimes come with rewards like money, Z-Crystals, and more! Click on a quest to teleport directly to the NPC needed to complete it.

### Shop

Trade in your hard-earned gems from Wormholes for powerful Ultra Space Gear! Gear is divided into 7 tiers (T1 Ruby up to T7 Ultra).

You can also:
- Get Drives for Iron Pilot (available at level 32)
- Obtain or Upgrade an Ultra Conduit, which lets you create a safe spot in Ultra Space (no gear needed while inside)

> **Gear Reminder:** Only US Crossbows work in Ultra Space Wormholes, regular bows/crossbows won't!

### Side NPC: Cozmo (Meteorite Trader)

Cozmo is where you go to trade Meteorites! Collect Meteorites by exploring or AFKing in Ultra Space—look for chat popups about meteor showers and listen for fireworks/explosions.

**Trade them with Cozmo for points:**

| Meteorite Type | Points |
|----------------|--------|
| Common         | 1      |
| Uncommon       | 3      |
| Rare           | 5      |
| Mythical       | 25     |

**Point Rewards:**
- **25 Points:** Fill an Empty Hoopa Ring
- **300 Points:** Obtain Deoxys

> If you want to change Deoxys's form, right-click Deoxys with a Mythical Meteorite!

### Need Quest Help?

If you get stuck, ask for help in the marketplace channel—generally, there's always an open ad for assistance with quests. Ultra Space is easier (and more fun!) with friends.

## 🌪️ Wormholes & Nests ✨

Wormholes only spawn in Ultra Space, appearing on a random player at random intervals. When one spawns on you, you'll see a deep blue chat message. Look around carefully, as wormholes do not show on your map and despawn after 5 minutes.

### Wormhole Tiers

Each wormhole is a different tier (refer to the infographic for visuals).

> **Note:** Tier 8 wormholes can only be spawned via Hoopa Rings.

### Got a Wormhole? Here's What to Do:

You can tackle Tier 1 solo (Ruby Gear is sufficient). For any tier above T1, creating a party is highly recommended.

**To form a party:**
1. Use `/party create`
2. Announce in chat: "Tx Wormhole on me 1/5"
3. Invite players with `/party invite (username)` (hover over nicknames in chat to see real usernames)
4. Once your group is ready, confirm in party chat with `/p` and check that everyone is ready before jumping in

### Wormhole Nest Objectives

You'll start with a 30-second prep timer—use it to set up shoulder mounts for extra effects (send out Pokémon with R, shift-right-click, and select the prompt). See Misc Wiki for a list of useful shoulder abilities.

When the timer ends, Pokémon waves will attack. Fight them with your sword (an Enchanted Netherite Sword is highly recommended—get upgrades at `/warp enchant` and craft using templates).

Defeat enough Pokémon to either return (Tier 1) or start new waves (higher tiers). Win by clearing all waves before losing too many lives. You'll be returned to your last location if you succeed.

### General Rewards

Completing a wormhole nest rewards you with gems, items, battle points, and a chance for an egg voucher!

### Ultra Beast and Tier 7-8 Wormhole Rewards

For players aiming for Ultra Beasts, good news! Completing Tier 7 or Tier 8 wormhole nests gives you a shot at these rare Pokémon, but there are some special rules:

- Ultra Beasts have a **20% chance** of being a reward in Tier 7, and a **50% chance** in Tier 8 (Tier 8 also offers a higher shiny chance!)

**The Ultra Beast you encounter depends on the biome where you complete the nest:**

| Ultra Beast | Biome |
|-------------|-------|
| Nihilego    | Ultra Deep Sea |
| Buzzwole    | Ultra Jungle |
| Pheromosa   | Ultra Desert |
| Xurkitree   | Ultra Plant |
| Kartana     | Ultra Forest |
| Celesteela  | Ultra Crater |
| Guzzlord    | Ultra Ruin |
| Blacephalon | Ultra Burst |
| Stakataka   | Ultra Grove |
| Naganadel   | Ultra Oasis |
| Giratina    | Distortion (requires Level 30+ in Ultra Space) |

### Special Ultra Space Legends

**Hoopa:** Reach Level 38 in Ultra Space and get a Prison Bottle (drops from Nihilego) for a chance to battle Hoopa. Be careful—Hoopa is very strong and can one-shot you!

To get a Tier 8 nest, you'll need a Hoopa ring, fill it at the Cozmo NPC, and right-click it in the correct biome. This will give you a random chance (between Tier 5 and 8) to spawn a wormhole, with Tier 8 giving the highest Ultra Beast odds.

> **Bonus:** Want a chance at better-tier wormholes? Place a Hoopa on your shoulder!

## 🐙 Nihilego Loot

Nihilego Loot works similarly to Drifblim Loots in Area Zero! There are three tiers, which you can identify by the color of the box that Nihilego is holding:

| Tier | Box Color |
|------|-----------|
| 1    | Gray      |
| 2    | Pink      |
| 3    | Blue      |

When they spawn, they will show up on your map as a dot named "Nihilego." You can shoot it down with a bow, use fusion to hit it with a sword, or use an Ultra Elytra as well!

Nihilego Loot has a chance to give gems, memories (including special ones), Hoopa Rings, and more! You can also obtain a new enchantment exclusive to Nihilego Loot—the **Singularity Enchantment Book**. This enchantment can only be found in Nihilego Loot in Ultra Space, NOT in Ultra Wild. Singularity works like Infinity, but for crossbows.

> **Note:** No matter if you are playing alone or in groups, the spawn chance will remain the same.

## 🧬 Silvally Memories & Information

### How to Obtain Silvally

You can obtain Type:Null by completing the Beast Killer quest. This involves giving Gladion all 17 type memories (excluding Normal), which can be collected as Nihilego loot or purchased from other players.

### To Evolve

Raise Type:Null's friendship by feeding it berries (Tamato or Pomeg) available at `/warp berryfarm`. Once friendship is high enough, Type:Null will evolve into Silvally.

### Silvally Memories

**Charge Mechanic:**

Memories are initially uncharged, indicated by `0/20 charges`. To charge a memory:

1. Equip the desired memory to your Silvally
2. Catch 20 Pokémon of the memory's corresponding type
3. Upon meeting this requirement, Silvally will consume the memory

**Progression:**

After Silvally has consumed 10 memories, it will be at full charge. This fully charged state allows you to access the Ultra Wilds (details on this will be provided below).

## 🌳 Ultra Wilds

### How to Access

To start an Ultra Wild Nest, you must have a fully charged Silvally and give it a Bloom, Mirror, or Cyclone Memory. These memories are obtainable from Nihilego loot. Once Silvally is holding the chosen memory, bring it to Aether Paradise and give it to the corresponding NPC. The memory will be consumed, and Silvally's charges will reset to 0.

### How They Work

Ultra Wild Nests are solo events. There are no waves—Pokémon continuously spawn around you. The goal is to defeat the aggressive Pokémon that appear. Since you will be swarmed, it is highly recommended to have Ultra Armor. You have 10 lives in an Ultra Wild Nest. If you lose all 10 lives, you will be ejected from the Ultra Wild Nest and forfeit any rewards.

To complete an Ultra Wild Nest, you must reach 500 Ultra Energy. After reaching this requirement, you may leave the Ultra Wild whenever you wish, but it is often beneficial to stay until your timer runs out to collect additional loot. If you want to exit early, use the command: `/ultrawild quit`.

Successfully completing an Ultra Wild Nest guarantees you the related Ultra Beast and additional random loot items from the Nihilego Loot pool.

**Ultra Wild Rewards:**
- **Florizim** can be obtained from Ultra Bloom
- **Wisphir** can be obtained from Ultra Cyclone
- **Glimmerix** can be obtained from Ultra Mirror

### Notes

- Nihilego Loot and Meteor Showers spawn much more frequently in the Ultra Wild
- Some loot items are exclusive to Ultra Wild Nests, such as the **N-Solarizer** and **N-Lunarizer**. These can be found in Meteor Showers in the Ultra Wild and are used to fuse Solgaleo and Lunala with Necrozma to create Dusk Mane Necrozma and Dawn Wings Necrozma
- Two unique enchantments can be found in the Ultra Wild:
  - **Aether Chain (I-III)** and **Aerial Bounty (I-II)** Enchantment Books can be obtained from Nihilego Loot
  - Aether Chain slows down Nihilego and Drifloot
  - Aerial Bounty increases the amount of items you receive from them
  - Both enchantments are for bows

## Aether Paradise

Faba is an NPC at the Aether Foundation who allows you to infuse custom Ultra Beasts into your Aether Armor, as well as obtain the armor itself. You can also check your quest progress with him.

Faba offers the best armor for Ultra Space—it's even better than Tier 7, although it is quite a grind to obtain. You'll need 400 Ultranium (100 for each armor piece). The base armor is stronger than Tier 7, and it has the unique ability to fuse the three custom Ultra Beasts: Florazim, Glimmerix, and Wisphir, into it.

**Here are the effects they add:**

| Ultra Beast | Effect |
|-------------|--------|
| Florazim    | When you attack mobs or aggressive Pokémon, they are poisoned |
| Glimmerix   | If you drop below 10 HP, you gain Resistance 3 for a few seconds (40-second cooldown) |
| Wisphir     | When you are hit, a wind charge is automatically launched toward the attacker |

> **Note:** Wisphir's effect is currently bugged and does not work as intended.

You must infuse all three Ultra Beasts into the armor to breathe in Ultra Space, and doing so will consume the Ultra Beasts. The armor is also enchantable.

## ⚔️ Ultra Space Trainers

While exploring or AFKing in Ultra Space, you may encounter Pokémon Trainers. These trainers can spawn near you, and they are also visible on the map. To begin a battle with them, simply right-click them. Be careful, as their teams are strong, so it is best to come prepared. Bringing Pokémon with the best IVs, full EV training, and at level 100 will help you succeed in these battles.

Defeating these trainers rewards you with Pokédollars and also gives you a chance to receive an Eternal Flower. You will need to collect 10 Eternal Flowers and give them to AZ to complete one of your Ultra Space Quests.

## Legendary Pokémon

### Solgaleo and Lunala

Solgaleo and Lunala spawn on a random person in Ultra Space every six hours. After one spawns, there is a six-hour cooldown before another appears. This pattern repeats continually. When one spawns, you will see a message that says, "A [Solgaleo/Lunala] has spawned." However, unless you see the boss bar, the spawn did not occur on you. If you defeat them with weapons, you will be put into a battle with Cosmog, which you can then catch. To evolve Cosmog into Solgaleo or Lunala, you will need a Sun Flute or Moon Flute. These flutes can be obtained by dowsing, nihiloot, or by purchasing them from other players.

> **Note:** There is no visible timer showing when the next Solgaleo or Lunala will spawn.

### Necrozma

You can obtain Necrozma by reaching Ultra Space level 31 and collecting seven Eclipse Shards. These shards can be obtained from players, dowsing, or wormholes. Once you have seven Eclipse Shards, go to Phyco at `/warp ultramegalopolis` and click on the quest book to catch Necrozma. Each account can only obtain one Necrozma.

### Tapu Kehe

You can obtain Tapu Kehe from Bloom Ultra Wilds.

### Cresselia

You can obtain Cresselia from Mirror Ultra Wilds.

### Azelf

You can obtain Azelf from Mirror Ultra Wilds.

### Mesprit

You can obtain Mesprit from Bloom Ultra Wilds.

### Uxie

You can obtain Uxie from Cyclone Ultra Wilds.

### Mewthree

You can obtain Mewthree from Cyclone Ultra Wilds.

### Giratina

To catch Giratina, you need to reach level 30 in Ultra Space. Then, complete a Tier 7 or higher wormhole in Ultra Space Distortion for an encounter with Giratina.

> **Note:** To obtain Origin Form Giratina, you will need a Griseous Core. You can get this item by completing Distortion Biome events at Tier 7 or higher. Then, right-click Giratina with the Griseous Core to change its form.

## 📎 General Information & Extra Details

You can comfortably handle Tier 1–3 wormholes with Ruby armor, especially if you are exploring with others. For higher tiers, it is strongly recommended to ask someone with higher-tier armor to assist you. Ideally, you should work on upgrading your armor. The best way to do this is by completing wormholes until you can reach Tiers 4–6, at which point you can obtain those armors. You may also purchase armor from other players, but remember that you still need to complete quests and wormholes yourself to progress. Simply owning Tier 7 armor does not guarantee success.

You can receive gem rewards from any tier, regardless of your progression level. For example, you are eligible for Tier 7 rewards from Tier 7 wormholes, even if you are only Tier 1 in terms of progression.

Nihilego fusion is another reward you can obtain. This allows you to breathe in Ultra Space and gives you access to a special dash ability, which you can bind in the controls menu. You must have Nihilego mounted on your shoulder to use this ability.

## ❓ FAQ ‼️

**Q: What shoulder effects does Nihilego or Poipole provide?**
A: Please see http://wiki.cobblemondelta.com/misc for full details. Use Left Shift to activate the Nihilego dash.

**Q: What counts as a "Banned Platform" in Ultra Space?**
A: A banned platform is any floating structure in the sky built solely for gaining spawns, dowsing, or meteorites. Building for aesthetic purposes is fine, and flattening land is also acceptable. If you spot a banned platform, please create a ticket in 🎫｜create-a-ticket and report it.

**Q: What are the easiest quests to do?**
A: Ease of quests depends on what you already have and your current progress. You may ask for suggestions in chat or refer to the relevant posts, but please do not spam or annoy others with repeated requests.

**Q: How big can I make my land?**
A: There is no size limit on claims in Ultra Space. Make your land as large as you wish; there is no required size to maximize spawns, meteorites, or other features.

**Q: Can I ban people from my claim?**
A: No. Banning other players from your Ultra Space claim is generally not allowed under the server rules. If you're experiencing an issue with a player, make a ticket, and a staff member can assist you further.

**Q: What is a Distortion Biome?**
A: Distortion Biomes are unique to Ultra Space. You can locate them by traveling down along the Y-axis. For more information, visit http://wiki.cobblemondelta.com/ultraspace

**Q: Where do wormholes spawn?**
A: Wormholes spawn near players.

**Q: Do wormholes show up on the map?**
A: No, they do not appear on the map.

**Q: How long does it take for wormholes to spawn?**
A: Wormhole spawns are random and may appear for any player at any time.

**Q: Does the spawn biome matter for Solgaleo or Lunala?**
A: No, the spawn biome does not affect them.

**Q: How do I get a Red Chain?**
A: Catch Mesprit, Azelf, or Uxie in the Ultra Wilds biome they appear in. Each catch gives a one-in-four chance to receive a Red Chain.

---

If you have any other questions, you can always ask in ❓｜questions for help or advice.

title: Armor Guide
subtitle: Best Armor
description: - **Tier 8 (T8)** - Best overall, allows breathing in Ultra Space
author: LLM
body:
# Armor Guide

## Best Armor

The best armor sets are:
- **Tier 8 (T8)** - Best overall, allows breathing in Ultra Space
- **Summer Armor** - High tier, event exclusive
- **Spring Armor** - High tier

If you want to explore Ultra Space without swapping armor, T8 is recommended as it provides breathing capability.

## Getting Started

For new players, enchanted Netherite armor is sufficient for dungeons. Obtain it at `/warp enchant` where you can grind enchantments and trade for gear.

## Ultra Space Armor

- **Ruby Armor** - Entry level for Ultra Space, buy at `/warp ultraspace` (5k per piece)
- **Aether Armor** - Best Ultra Space armor, obtained from Faba at `/warp aetherfoundation`

title: Battle Points
subtitle: How to Earn Battle Points
description: Battle Points (BP) can be earned from:
author: LLM
body:
# Battle Points

## How to Earn Battle Points

Battle Points (BP) can be earned from:
- `/raids`
- `/dungeons`
- `/battlefactory`
- Spectating gym battles

## Where to Spend Battle Points

- `/warp battleshop` - Ability patches, bottle caps, and more
- `/warp tms` - Purchase TM moves
- `/warp dojo`
- `/warp coffeeshop`
- `/warp energyshop`

## Ability Patching

At `/warp battleshop`, you can use an Ability Patch to change a Pokemon's ability to its Hidden Ability. This costs Battle Points and makes the Pokemon unbreedable.

## Bottle Caps (Hyper Training)

At `/warp battleshop`, talk to the NPC to hyper train your Pokemon's IVs using Battle Points.

## One-Time IV Fix

Use `/fixivs (slot)` once per Paradox, Ultra Beast, or Legendary Pokemon to fix its IVs. This can only be used once per eligible Pokemon.

## Trading Battle Points

You cannot directly pay someone Battle Points. To trade BP value, you must purchase items for each other.

title: Useful Commands
subtitle: Money and Trading
description: | `/pay (player) (amount)` | Send money to another player |
author: LLM
body:
# Useful Commands

## Money and Trading

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/pay (player) (amount)` | Send money to another player |
| `/balance (currency type)` | Check your balance for a specific currency |
| `/gts sell (slot) (price)` | List a Pokemon for sale on the GTS |
| `/gts claim` | Collect money/Pokemon from GTS and shop chests |
| `/buy` | Opens link to purchase credits |

## Pokemon Management

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/pokegift (player) (slot)` | Gift a Pokemon to another player |
| `/show (slot)` | Display a Pokemon in chat |
| `/rideablepokemon` | See which Pokemon you can ride |
| `/resetev (slot) (stat)` | Reset a specific EV stat on a Pokemon |
| `/fixivs (slot)` | One-time IV fix for Paradox/UB/Legendary Pokemon |
| `/unbreedable (slot)` | Neuter a Pokemon (make it unbreedable) |

To ride a Pokemon, right click its hitbox after sending it out.

To give a Pokemon a held item, Shift + Right Click the Pokemon while holding the item.

## Chat Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/p (message)` | Send a message to your party |
| `/d (message)` | Send a message to Delta chat (no toggle) |

## Navigation

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/rtp` | Random teleport to the wild |
| `/sethome (name)` | Set a private home |
| `/home (name)` | Teleport to your home |
| `/setwarp (name)` | Create a public warp (costs 100k) |

## Miscellaneous

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/catchcombo` | Check your current catch combo |
| `/checkcompletion` | Claim rewards for completed bingo tasks |
| `/supporter monthly` | Claim monthly supporter rewards |
| `/supporter daily` | Claim daily supporter rewards |
| `/pokedex search (pokemon)` | Look up Pokemon information |
| `/dungeons` | Open dungeon menu |
| `/raids` | Open raid menu |
| `/gyms` | Open gym menu |
| `/eventshop` | Open event shop |

title: Crate Keys
subtitle: How to Use Keys
description: Use your crate keys at `/warp crate`.
author: LLM
body:
# Crate Keys

## How to Use Keys

Use your crate keys at `/warp crate`.

## How to Get Crate Keys

Crate keys can be obtained from:
- Event Shop (using Event Points)
- Giveaways
- Online credit shop

## Plush Crate Keys

Plush keys can be obtained from:
- Online credit shop
- Game Corner coins
- Rare chance when interacting with a Poke Stop

title: Egg Vouchers
subtitle: Claiming Your Eggs
description: After rolling egg vouchers at the Egg Machine:
author: LLM
body:
# Egg Vouchers

## Claiming Your Eggs

After rolling egg vouchers at the Egg Machine:

1. Return to the Egg Machine
2. Click the **Ticket Icon** (not the green roll button)
3. This opens your egg storage
4. Click on eggs to claim the Pokemon inside

Your egg backpack has a limit. If full, newly prepared eggs cannot be added until you make space.

title: Hard Dungeons
subtitle: Requirements
description: To run hard mode dungeons, you need a **Catalyst**.
author: LLM
body:
# Hard Dungeons

## Requirements

To run hard mode dungeons, you need a **Catalyst**.

## Creating a Catalyst

1. Obtain a **Prismatic Frag** and an **Oreheart**
2. Go to `/warp Outpost2`
3. Combine them to create a Catalyst

## Using the Catalyst

Keep the Catalyst in your inventory when starting a dungeon. A message will prompt asking if you want to run hard mode.

title: Master Balls
subtitle: How to Get Master Balls
description: Master Balls can be obtained through:
author: LLM
body:
# Master Balls

## How to Get Master Balls

Master Balls can be obtained through:
- Master Ball Pokeloot in dungeons
- Defeating Alpha Pokemon
- Dowsing in Area Zero
- Killing Driftloot in Area Zero
- Event Shop (`/eventshop`)
- Crafting

title: Mega Evolution
subtitle: How to Mega Evolve
description: Mega Evolution can only be used in battle. When you get into battle, there is a mega evolution button below your moves. Click it, then select a move.
author: LLM
body:
# Mega Evolution

## How to Mega Evolve

Mega Evolution can only be used in battle. When you get into battle, there is a mega evolution button below your moves. Click it, then select a move.

You cannot mega evolve outside of battle.

## How to Get Mega Stones

Mega stones can be obtained through:
- Drifloot/Driftblimps in Area Zero
- Dowsing in Area Zero
- NPC or player shops

## Rayquaza

Rayquaza requires a special quest to unlock its mega evolution. Complete the mission at `/warp rayquazaquest`.

title: Pokedex Tasks
subtitle: What Are Pokedex Tasks?
description: Every Pokemon has research tasks you can complete for rewards. View them by:
author: LLM
body:
# Pokedex Tasks

## What Are Pokedex Tasks?

Every Pokemon has research tasks you can complete for rewards. View them by:
- Using `/pokedex search (pokemon)` and hovering over the pokedex icon
- Right-clicking a Pokemon while holding your Poketch

## Task Rewards

Some tasks give immediate rewards upon completion.

## Milestone Rewards

| Tasks Completed | Reward |
|-----------------|--------|
| 200 | Master Rod |
| 500 | Shiny Celebi |

Additional milestone rewards exist beyond these.

title: Raid Information
subtitle: Raid Reset
description: Raids reset at 12:00 AM EST every day. You receive 3 raid charges that refresh at 6am and 6pm EST.
author: LLM
body:
# Raid Information

## Raid Reset

Raids reset at 12:00 AM EST every day. You receive 3 raid charges that refresh at 6am and 6pm EST.

## Raid Requirements

- You need exactly 3 Pokemon in your party
- Certain moves are banned (such as Curse)
- All party members need a raid charge to participate

title: Sandwiches
subtitle: How to Get Sandwiches
description: Sandwiches cannot be crafted. You must kill Alpha Pokemon to get sandwiches as drops.
author: LLM
body:
# Sandwiches

## How to Get Sandwiches

Sandwiches cannot be crafted. You must kill Alpha Pokemon to get sandwiches as drops.

Alpha Pokemon can be found in the wild or during swarms. Note that Alphas in Entralink do not drop sandwiches.

## Shiny Sandwiches

Shiny sandwiches boost the shiny rate for a specific Pokemon type. To make a shiny sandwich:

1. Go to `/warp sandwich`
2. Combine 2 unique Herba Mysticas with the sandwich type you want to boost

title: Server Information
subtitle: Available Servers
description: All servers share the same data and features with one exception:
author: LLM
body:
# Server Information

## Available Servers

All servers share the same data and features with one exception:

- **Alpha, Gamma, Epsilon, Zeta** - Peaceful mode (no hostile mobs)
- **Omega** - Hard mode with hostile mobs (zombies, creepers, etc.)

## Server Resets

The server never resets. Your claims, Pokemon, and progress are permanent. If you take a break and return, everything will still be there.

## Keep Inventory

Keep inventory is enabled on all servers. You will not lose items when you die.

## Player Data Reset

You cannot reset your player data.

title: Chest Shops
subtitle: Creating a Shop Chest
description: 2. Hold the item you want to sell in your hand
author: LLM
body:
# Chest Shops

## Creating a Shop Chest

To create a chest shop:

1. Place a chest
2. Hold the item you want to sell in your hand
3. Shift + Left Click the chest

This will create a shop where other players can buy your items.

## Claiming Shop Money

To collect money from your shop sales, use:

```
/gts claim
```

This command also retrieves unsold Pokemon from the GTS after 24 hours.

title: Special Pokemon
subtitle: Meltan and Melmetal
description: To evolve Meltan into Melmetal:
author: LLM
body:
# Special Pokemon

## Meltan and Melmetal

To evolve Meltan into Melmetal:

1. Use `/pokedex search meltan` to view the research task
2. Catch 100 Meltan
3. You will be awarded a Meltan Box
4. Use the Meltan Box to evolve Meltan into Melmetal (one-time use)

## Koraidon and Miraidon

To obtain Koraidon or Miraidon:

1. Obtain a Korai Key or Mirai Key (rare dungeon reward, or buy from players)
2. Catch 100 Paradox Pokemon in `/warp areazero` to fill the key
3. Use the filled key to encounter Koraidon/Miraidon

## Ash-Greninja (Battle Bond)

Battle Bond Greninja can be caught by fishing with a Super Rod, Master Rod, or Spectral Rod at "Feebas level" spawn (fast, erratic fish in the minigame).

Battle Bond works like pre-Gen 9: Greninja transforms into Ash-Greninja in battle.

title: Terastallization
subtitle: How to Terastalize
description: 1. Gather all types of Tera Shards
author: LLM
body:
# Terastallization

## How to Terastalize

To terastalize your Pokemon:

1. Gather all types of Tera Shards
2. Give them to Professor Turo at the Tera Outposts

Once unlocked, you can terastalize your Pokemon in battle.
